video.title: PBS News Hour full episode, June 23, 2025
video.description:
Monday on the News Hour, Iran launches missiles at a U.S. base in the Middle East in retaliation for the strikes on its nuclear facilities. New York City prepares to vote in the Democratic mayoral primary that could have national implications. Plus, Alaska's Republican Sen. Lisa Murkowski discusses her new memoir about adapting to Washington politics and the Trump era.

WATCH TODAY’S SEGMENTS:
How Iran's response to U.S. signaled a desire to de-escalate
https://youtu.be/ke4q4O22p8Y
Retired U.S. vice admiral analyzes Iran conflict
https://youtu.be/qfgnNFlCicc
Some Republicans clash with Trump over Iran strikes
https://youtu.be/OLnCwzfpBXM 
News Wrap: Supreme Court allows deportations amid appeals
https://youtu.be/-WxgaCCwDTI
NYC mayoral primary could forecast the future for Democrats
https://youtu.be/F7Ab3OwTwic
Murkowski on new memoir and adapting to Trump era politics
https://youtu.be/75nX41Gi1IM
Tamara Keith and Amy Walter on impact of conflict with Iran
https://youtu.be/1nRZCdUGzVw
